name: Accredited ITIL Intermediate - Service Transition
subtitle: Service Transition
description: In these episodes we look at the transition of an IT service from a design plan to a live service. We examine closely processes such as Change Management and Release and Deployment Management and we also look at what services are made of in Service Asset & Configuration Management. We look at the concept of early life support and also the value of knowledge in enabling decision making. Like all ITIL shows we also look at critical success factors and key performance indicators and we do some exam prep too!
descriptionMD: In these episodes we look at the transition of an IT service from a design plan to a live service. We examine closely processes such as Change Management and Release and Deployment Management and we also look at what services are made of in Service Asset & Configuration Management. We look at the concept of early life support and also the value of knowledge in enabling decision making. Like all ITIL shows we also look at critical success factors and key performance indicators and we do some exam prep too! For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please [contact PassionIT Group](mailto:info@passionitgroup.com).

episodes.title: Introduction to ITIL Intermediate
episodes.description: In these episodes we look at the transition of an IT service from a design plan to a live service. We examine closely processes such as Change Management and Release and Deployment Management and we also look at what services are made of in Service Asset & Configuration Management. We look at the concept of early life support and also the value of knowledge in enabling decision making. Like all ITIL shows we also look at critical success factors and key performance indicators and we do some exam prep too! For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please contact PassionIT Group.

episodes.title: ITIL Foundation Refresher
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Jo begin the foundation refresher. Jo reviews the key aspects of ITIL foundation by describing the 5 core volume service lifecycles: service strategy, service design, service transition, service operation, and continual service improvement. She also defines what ITIL means by a Service and Service Management. Also the key terms that define value: Utility and Warranty by Jo.

episodes.title: ITIL Foundation Refresher Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Jo continue with the foundation refresher. Jo reviews asset, resource, capabilities and processes from the ITIL perspective. She emphasizes the process model and roles associated with processes. Lastly, she describes the accountability that belongs to the service owner as well.

episodes.title: Objectives and Principles
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee explain the importance of  ensuring  any modifications to the IT environment affecting new, modified or retiring services meet the expectations of the business, customers and users.

episodes.title: Managing People Through Transitions
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee introduce a high-level view of the communications and management activities which support service transition. They discuss effective ways to manage communications, commitment and more.  Tune in to learn the emotional cycle and understand how to motivate.

episodes.title: Managing People Through Transitions Part 2
episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Jo cover the aspects of organizational roles and responsibilities, along with how to plan and implement organizational change. In addition, they also explain methods, practices and techniques relating to assessing organizational readiness for, monitoring progress of,  and organizational change.

episodes.title: Managing People Through Transitions Part 3
episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Jo discuss how to manage Stakeholders. JO explains the importance of Stakeholder management strategy, changes in stakeholder commitment and even shares tools such as a Stakeholder map to help perform analysis.

episodes.title: ST Processes - Transition Planning and Support
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee take a look at how to streamline a process through the use of process models. They encourage the use of process models to facilitate efficient and effective processes that are appealing and not perceived as bureaucratic.

episodes.title: Process Models
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee take a look at how to streamline a process through the use of process models. They encourage the use of process models to facilitate efficient and effective processes that are appealing and not perceived as bureaucratic.

episodes.title: ST Processes - Change Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and JO define Change  Management as a way to control the lifecycle of all changes whilst enabling beneficial changes to be made with minimum disruption to IT Services. Jo explains the numerous ways it should add value to a business and not add add layers of complexity or bureaucracy.

episodes.title: ST Process - Change Management Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo continue to discuss Change Management. Jo explains how it adds value to the business, characterizes qualities of poor Change Management, and more. She also shows the differences between normal, standard and emergency changes. Tune in for more!

episodes.title: ST Processes - Change Management Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo continue to discuss Change Management. Jo identifies inputs such as policies and strategies, RFCs, and change proposals. She them compares those inputs to what an expected output looks like.

episodes.title: ST Processes - SACM
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo explain the purpose of Configuration Management and how it ensures  the assets required to deliver services are properly controlled, that accurate and reliable information about those assets is available when and where required and includes details of how the assets have been configured and the relationships between them.

episodes.title: ST Processes - SACM Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Cherokee continue to discuss SACM. Specifically, Jo describes the breakdown of configuration management systems and the including the logical layers of the Configuration Management System (CMS). In addition to internal structure Jo explains the integration of the Definitive Media Library (DMS), and the Configuration Management Data Base(s) (CMDB).

episodes.title: ST Processes - Change Evaluation
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee explain how Change Evaluation provides a consistent and standardized means of determining the performance of a service change in the context of likely impacts on business outcomes and on existing services and infrastructure.

episodes.title: ST Processes - Service Validation and Testing
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee explain how to plan and implement a structured validation and test process in addition to explaining the significance to provide an expected quality assurance. Jo also covers how to identify, assess and address issues throughout Service Transition.

episodes.title: ST Processes - Service Validation, Testing Pt. 2
episodes.description: In this show Cherokee and Jo continue talking about service validation and testing. Jo reminds us how how this concept will not be a one size fits all as it greatly depends on what we are testing and how we are testing it. They discuss examples of KPIs to help determine various CSFs. Tune in for all this and more!

episodes.title: ST Processes - Release and Deployment Mgmt
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo outline how to plan, schedule and control the build They also explain how to manage test and deployment of releases in addition to delivering new functionality required by the business while protecting the integrity of existing services.

episodes.title: ST Processes - Release and Deployment Mgmt Pt.2
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee continue to discuss Release and Deployment Management . Jo explains the differences between a release process trigger versus a deployment trigger. They also examine how those triggers interface with the four phases of Release and Deployment Management. Inputs, outputs and more are covered as well!

episodes.title: ST Processes - Knowledge Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo foster ideas on how to share perspectives, ideas, experience and information. They also stress the need to  ensure these  ideas are available to enable informed decisions; and to reduce the need to rediscover knowledge. Jo encourages the idea idea of Service Knowledge Management System (SKMS)  as a logical way to interrogate data and the relationships between the configuration items thus providing knowledge and facts to help execute informed decisions.

episodes.title: Technology Considerations
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Jo cover technology considerations for service transition. Technology’s role in service transition is explored, as well as how it should be “designed in”. They also share the mechanisms for maintaining and maximizing benefit from the technology. A range of tools are reviewed from enterprise-wide tools through to more specific ITSM technology and support tools.

episodes.title: Implementing Service Transition
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee use the CSI approach to implement Service Transition. Jo walks through the various stages involved and highlights key activities in the introduction of service transition.

episodes.title: Challenges, CSFs and Risks
episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee cover the challenges and critical success factors  critical success factors(CSF) facing service transition. They also explain how risk mitigation contributes to service transition.

episodes.title: Exam Review Introduciton
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Jo review some of the different techniques and details when sitting for your ITIL Intermediate exam. They recommend downloading the sample paper for review. Jo reviews the details on scoring of the exam. She also has solid exam advice for delegates preparing for an exam.

episodes.title: Exam Review
episodes.description: ITIL Intermediate Service Transition exam review

episodes.title: Exam Review Part 2
episodes.description: ITIL Intermediate Service Transition exam review
